basic.description: This course introduces future entrepreneurs to the concept of financial thinking by utilizing tools and techniques which have been adapted for use in the realm of entrepreneurship. It is designed to inform students of various techniques of obtaining financing for new enterprises and to maximize the financial potential of their existing companies and is structured to train students in the financial management of entrepreneurial firms. As most are small growing firms, understanding finance requires an understanding of marketing, management, and planning functions of these firms.
basic.subject: ENT
basic.title: New Venture Finance

extra.enrollment_requirement: Prerequisites: ENT 2010 with a grade of "B-" or better and ENT 2011 with a grade of "B-" or better. Corequisite: FIN 3403.
